entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is introduced as a character who has modified a motorcycle. He is described as being oblivious to Harry's discomfort.

entities.name: hedwig
entities.description: Hedwig is mentioned as Hagrid's owl, whose cage is placed between his knees on the motorcycle.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is introduced as a character who is uncomfortable with the modified motorcycle.

entities.name: arthur weasley
entities.description: Arthur Weasley is mentioned as being concerned about the safety of the modified motorcycle.

entities.name: moody
entities.description: Moody is introduced as a character who wants everyone to leave at exactly the same time.

relationships.description: Hagrid owns Hedwig, whose cage is placed between his knees on the motorcycle. (Excerpt: 'Hedwig’s cage between his knees.')

Hagrid has modified a motorcycle, which is described as having 'a few tricks up its hindquarters now'. (Excerpt: 'Arthur’s done a bit o’ tinkerin’... It’s got a few tricks up its hindquarters now. Tha’ one was my idea.')
Hagrid is riding the modified motorcycle, which creaks slightly and sinks into the ground. (Excerpt: 'He settled himself astride the motorcycle... It was extremely uncomfortable.')
Harry is riding on the modified motorcycle, which is described as being uncomfortable. (Excerpt: 'It was extremely uncomfortable.')

Moody is leading a group of people, including Harry and Hagrid, who are about to leave at exactly the same time. (Excerpt: 'I want 54 The Seven Potters us all to leave at exactly the same time or the whole point of the diversion’s lost.')
